com.att.research.xacml.api

Enum Decision

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Decision>
      • com.att.research.xacml.api.Decision
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Decision>

    public enum Decision
extends java.lang.Enum<Decision>
    Enumeration of the XACML 3.0 decisions and extended decisions that can be returned as part of a Result.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      DENY
      Indicates the request is denied
      INDETERMINATE
      Indicates no decision could be reached due to a processing error
      INDETERMINATE_DENY
      Indicates no decision could be reached due to a processing error, but it would have been denied had the error not occurred.
      INDETERMINATE_DENYPERMIT
      Indicates no decision could be reached due to a processing error, but either a deny or permit would have been returned had the error not occurred.
      INDETERMINATE_PERMIT
      Indicates no decision could be reached due to a processing error, but it would have been permitted had the error not occurred
      NOTAPPLICABLE
      Indicates the policy in question is not applicable to the request
      PERMIT
      Indicates the request is permitted

        Indicates no decision could be reached due to a processing error

      • INDETERMINATE_PERMIT

        public static final Decision INDETERMINATE_PERMIT
        Indicates no decision could be reached due to a processing error, but it would have been permitted had the error not occurred

      • INDETERMINATE_DENY

        public static final Decision INDETERMINATE_DENY
        Indicates no decision could be reached due to a processing error, but it would have been denied had the error not occurred.

      • INDETERMINATE_DENYPERMIT

        public static final Decision INDETERMINATE_DENYPERMIT
        Indicates no decision could be reached due to a processing error, but either a deny or permit would have been returned had the error not occurred.

        Indicates the policy in question is not applicable to the request
